Elevated Terrain!

I plan on creating some add-ons for this plug-in in the future that might include more levels of terrain and more decorations.

Fake hills.descrip:
This plugin shows a new feature called "frame alignment area". Set this attribute to true, and you will be able to build your plugin with an areal tool (similar to "frame alignment" which lets you build in a linear way). In order to work you have to provide 16 frames which represent all neighbor combinations.

For fake hills our image looks like



fake_terrain.png (8 KiB) Viewed 1386 times



And the code for three distinct heights
Code: Select all[
  {
    "id":"$deco_fake_terrain00",
    "type":"decoration",
    "title":"Terrain level 1",
    "text":"",
    "width":1,
    "height":1,
    "frames":[{"bmp":"fake_terrain.png","w":32,"h":20,"count":16}],
    "frame alignment area":true
  },
  {
    "id":"$deco_fake_terrain01",
    "type":"decoration",
    "title":"Terrain level 2",
    "text":"",
    "width":1,
    "height":1,
    "frames":[{"bmp":"fake_terrain.png","w":32,"h":20,"count":16,"handle y":16}],
    "frame alignment area":true
  },
  {
    "id":"$deco_fake_terrain02",
    "type":"decoration",
    "title":"Terrain level 3",
    "text":"",
    "width":1,
    "height":1,
    "frames":[{"bmp":"fake_terrain.png","w":32,"h":20,"count":16,"handle y":20}],
    "frame alignment area":true
  }
]

Note:
I don't want to compete with other plugins in any way. The purpose of this plugin is to show how things can be done so you can use it in your own projects. For this reason you may use this plugin (images and json) however you want, also without giving credit to me or theo. Have fun

Hills by KoalaGuy & mdk_813 || Update 2.descrip:
Hello fellow Theonians,
Mdk_813 and I got you a great one today. Hills. Yes, hills. No, they're not just decorations, you can actually build on them! A whole city on a hill! Imagine the possibilities!
Apart from manual building which requires you to place every piece by yourself, I made a much simpler system - Automatic Hills/Holes. To use them, just pause the game, make a shape of the hill you want, unpause the game, and boom! A hill! You'll have to remove some dirt after that, but it takes about 5 seconds. 
You can also make holes, and make your inhabitants live in a big hole, evil but cool  .
So what are you waiting for? Download the plugin and make some hills on this flat planet! 
We hope you like it!  

Download here

• Added graphics for winter time

Based on textures by Lobby and Theo

Parking Lots UPDATE [Terrain] by mdk_813.author: mdk_813
Parking Lots UPDATE [Terrain] by mdk_813.descrip:
Hi there,
today I have a terrain-tool that might be useful for anyone who was ever unnerved by placing  a larger number of deco parking lots before.

YES!
Your prayers have been answered!
Now you can finally bring the progress of civilization into your cities and conveniently turn all the ugly and dirty landscape into neatly arranged parking lots.   
Parking lots as far as the eye can see...

The tool works just like the trees from the terrain menu. You can draw out zones that are filled randomly with 1x1 parking lots or you can pick specific variants to build. The lots do not have any influence on anything. They are pure eye-candy.
In case the first build was not varied enough you can just zone over the parts that are bothering you until you reach a satisfying result.

The graphics were for the most part originally made by Lobby and Theo. I just had the idea and compiled the various lots to form this tool. Most lots are (more or less) the same as the existing deco parking lots, but I added some new ones for the sake of variety.
In total, this tool contains 17 different 1x1 lots (from A to Q). One blank lot and 16 lots that are filled with one or two cars.

Have fun!

UPDATE
This is a very important update, I highly recommend redownloading to anyone who has downloaded the plugin before!
The update fixes the "auto build" option in order to prevent the parking lots from spawning when creating a new city with trees.
Sorry, for the inconvenience!

Palms and Bushes UPDATE by mdk_813.author: mdk_813
Palms and Bushes UPDATE by mdk_813.descrip:
Hi folks,
I've created some simple palms and bushes for the terrain menu.
The plugin adds two new entries to the terrain menu, which each include a randomizer as well as several single or grouped palms/bushes to choose directly. It basically works like the in-game trees in the same menu.
Please note: The preview image for both entries is the same as for the original trees. I guess this is due to the fact that there is just one standard preview for a randomizer in the game. I'm sorry for that. But at least you can distinguish the plugin by the provided texts.

The palms and bushes are probably best suited for maps with the sand texture but they also work reasonably well on the original green ground texture.

I would like to give a special thanks to CommanderABab, without whom I would not have been able to complete this plugin!

Have fun!

P.S.: The rocks in the picture below are no part of the plugin. They are original content of the game and can be found in the decoration menu.
P.P.S.: It would be nice, if Lobby added these rocks to the terrain menu as well. Please 

UPDATE
I have added a new file (Palms_Bushes_terrain.mdk_813_NON_AUTO_BUILD.zip) with "auto build":false, which will prevent the palms and bushes from being built automatically alongside the ingame trees when you create a new city. Just replace the old folder with the new one!

Poison oak and a surprise..descrip:
Be sure to see this first!  The map creation time for giant map is over 5 minutes.  Probably causing a lot of exceptions.

http://www.theotown.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=2138



The red oaks are poison oaks with great pollution influence due to the poisonous itchy substance that emanates from them.  Unfortunately, there is also a great noise influence due to the flocks of birds (crows and aizat  birds) that come to eat the white berries.  The influences don't match, so finding spots to build residential free of pollution and noise is tough.  Industrial doesn't mind them, and commercial doesn't seem to either. 

 You may want to make a backup of  copy your maps and/or region folder to prevent the spread of this tree to maps you like or have spent a great deal of time on.

Best used on a new city for a challenge using trees of course!  Huge or giant maps will be best, as smaller maps may be completely covered with pollution and noise.  To start a city, you would have to do a great deal of removal first.




https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bw7X9l ... p=drivesdk

S-Bahn System (inter-station category).author: mdk_813
S-Bahn System (inter-station category).descrip:
Hi guys,
I've finished my S-Bahn system which you may have seen in part already in the Inter-station thread: http://www.theotown.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=42&t=5338
"S-Bahn" is an abbreviation for "Stadtschnellbahn" which means rapid city-train. It is intended as a quick commuter train for local or regional transportation.

This plugin contains:
- railways (a normal version and a slower version for stations) with bridge frames.
- functional stations in two variants (one to be placed at the side of a single railway, another to be placed in between two railways)
- non-functional deco tiles to extend the station platforms.
- a German-style S-Bahn.
- a Gravel Decal to extend the railway areas.

I recommend using bridges to cross normal roads in order to avoid unwanted effects.

The plugin requires the inter-station category by KINGTUT101 to work. You can download it from here:
http://www.theotown.com/forum/viewtopic ... 364#p72364
Put the downloaded category folder into your plugin folder! Make sure the categories' folder name starts with a 1, so that it is read in by the game before the S-Bahn plugin!

NOTE: If you have already used the earlier version of the platforms for decoration purposes, delete them in your cities and from your plugin folder before installing this plugin!

Credits:
mdk_813
@Lobby  & @theotheoderich  (trees)
@KINGTUT10101 (tram and JSON templates)
@22Alpha (rails and JSON templates)

P.S. According to KINGTUT101 this plugin should be compatible with the other train and tram systems. Thanks for checking!

Metro System by KoalaGuy.descrip:
KoalaGuy wrote: ↑Tue Nov 21, 2017 16:32
EUREKA!  

Hello fellow Theonians (except @Matison55557  ), today I got a great, long awaited plugin - metro system!
Now you can build rails underground which can save space and is cool! The rails are built on underground water pipe level and they transfer water too, so don't worry about destroying water systems. You'll need a metro station to allow people to come in the trains. If you have a metro station without connected rails, if won't work (duh). Also, the normal water pipes transfer water to rail systems, via small canals so they can cross to other side of normal pipes.
I hope you like it, enjoy!

- Original pipes by Lobby & Theo, recolored by KoalaGuy

Residential Suburban Zone by Matison5555.descrip:
This plugin adds a new type of residential zone. It can only spawn smaller residential buildings.
No mansions or apartment complexes. Just houses. Great for suburban areas.  
Works just like my medieval zone, it uses ingame buildings but hidden in the menu, and they have new IDs. However this time, instead of x and y I used frame stealing.

Download

Note that there may be some discussion about whether some buildings would be houses or apartment complexes. I chose buildings for this plugin based on my own opinion, and how I see these buildings. Also, buildings from this plugin can have different populations than their ingame versions, because TheoTown adds a bit of randomness to the population.

Hopefully you will enjoy this plugin and find some use for it! You can use the Show your suburbs thread to show how you use this plugin. 

The zone contains:
39 buildings for level T
6 buildings for level TT
5 buildings for level TTT
All use ingame graphics.

Rural Housing Pack.author: cesareborgia94
Rural Housing Pack.descrip:
Hi, I have a present for you all this December. 





I present to you, folks, Rural Housing. Now you can build homes for the villagers in rural areas. Rural homes can house from one to five villagers depending on the type. 

There are housings that can only house one villager, guess he is a loner and some housings can house two, four or five villagers. 

Advantages of rural housing:
1. Does not need roads. Hence you can place them on any ground types you want without a road connection similar to rural villages in real life.
2. No electricity needed. Most of the rural villages are used to a traditional lifestyle and would want to keep it their it their way.
3.Build is auto false. The rural housing will not build itself as to not impede the building of other level 1 houses. This means that you have more control in placing your rural houses.

Disadvantages:
1.Low population density. Rural villages are unsuitable if you want a booming population. If you want to control the population you can use rural housing to do it.
2. Some rural houses still needs water, except for leantos and woodhuts. Means you need a clean water supply for those houses.





Types of rural housing
1.Leantos- Colorful roof, fast made shelter but can only house a lonely guy. Lonely people works as lumberjack or hunter in the rural community.
2.Woodhuts- Rural house made of planks and wood, can only house two people
3.Shanty house- Big brother of woodhut.
4.Bomb ruins- A remnant of some old war, some villagers still choose to live inside it.
5.Skumole-A place for reformed criminals, inspiration from Skumole Shack in GTA VC.
6.Stonehut- A medieval stone hut, probably houses a wizard family or a group of farmers.
7.SHC hovels- Replica of hovels from Stronghold Crusader that will house some peasants.
8.Wood resind- Two villagers and three workers. This is just a test to see if workers can fit in a residential type.

This rural housing pack also includes pedestrian spawners. Pedestrian spawners use the woodhut and hovel texture. Also, I want to give credit to @KINGTUT10101  for the json code on pedestrians, since I used his code to experiment with my own residential pedestrian spawner.

Download rural housing pack here:

 ruralhousing.zip
(57.39 KiB) Downloaded 109 times


Again, feel free to try my plugin. I hope you guys have fun with it. Also Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all Theonians.

Zoned Area Roads.descrip:
Zoned Area Roads





Instructions:

1. Zone an area corresponding to road type.
2. Make sure it has water, electricity, and parks.
  For residential: schools also.
  For commercial: sports also.
3.Build the roads; and place some bus stops, fire, and police.
4. Enjoy!  Some challenges surely await!



 Zoned Area Roads.zip
(240.91 KiB) Downloaded 175 times



You may download if you like for personal use only. 


Each building has 500 residents or workers and is built as the road is built as long as the area has already been zoned corresponding to the road being used.  You may zone regular or dense, it doesn't matter, the buildings will still be built.  They are level 2.
50T for residential road, 501T for industrial and commercial.  

Each zone has it's own car.

Torre de Theo mdk_813 UPDATE 2 [res/com].author: mdk_813
Torre de Theo mdk_813 UPDATE 2 [res/com].descrip:
Hi folks,
today I have a building, that is inspired by a tower in the Dominican Republic which was recently suggested by @Nexus24680 . As my building is not an exact replica of this real-life counterpart, I decided to give it a different name that celebrates our favorite game and its creator(s).
The building comes in four variations, three TT-residentials and one TT-commercial office building, each on 3x3-lots, which differ in height and appearance.
I used a tree by Lobby & Theo in two of the variants.

Please note:
I have made slight changes to the roofs of the red and yellow buildings by now, which are not reflected in the preview image (sorry, I was to lazy to update the image).

Have fun!

UPDATE:
I adjusted the shadows a bit, so that the building has some more shape. Please replace your existing folder with the new one provided here!
Please also note, that I did not the upate the preview image below.

UPDATE 2:
I've added a second version of the plugin with ingame trees instead of palmtrees. Both plugins are interchangeable, so no need to bulldoze existing houses in your city, but you cannot use both versions at the same time. So, if you want to turn your city into a palm-free zone than download the second version and replace your existing folder

Gas Station Pack by mdk_813 [commercial].author: mdk_813
Gas Station Pack by mdk_813 [commercial].descrip:
Hi guys,
I've created a Gas Station Pack that contains four variants of gas stations from different oil-companies.
The  gas stations are 3x3 level-1 commercial buildings with 40 workers.
The buildings were designed by me, but the cars used on the lots are some of the original cars from Theotown made by Lobby and theotheoderich.
The tarmac texture was also created by me, but it is designed to align with the commercial parking lot pieces in the decorations menu.
In sandbox mode the gas station appears as one entry with four options to choose.
In simulation mode the four variants should build randomly.

If any problems occur, especially in simulation mode, please let me know!

UPDATE:
I realized that the scale of the building was a bit of. As people are 3 pixels tall in Theotown, the windows and roofs of the gas stations were too high. So I lowered them a bit. This is really only a minor change and if you are not bothered by the original scale, then there is no real need to download the new version.
But if you do want to update the plugin, then you only need to replace the old pngs in your plugin folder with the new ones provided in this update, because the json was not changed.

Hi,
here I got a highrise level 3 commercial building on a 4x4 lot.

Breakwater/Seawall Set by mdk_813 UPDATE.author: mdk_813
Breakwater/Seawall Set by mdk_813 UPDATE.descrip:
Hi,
here I have a Breakwater/Seawall Set for your coastlines. It appears in the park menu.
It contains a set of straights (with and without a signalling lamp), inner corners, outer corners (all to be placed on the water tile next to the shore) and an endpiece (to be placed on land).
You have to rotate the pieces to the desired orientation and puzzle together your custom coastlines. It might seem a bit complicated but it gets pretty easy and quick once you get the hang of it 
Please note that the seawall only looks good, if the coast tile next to it is covered by another piece from the game, a street or a plaza etc. Bare land next to the pieces will leave gaps and look weird. ALternatively, you can also place the pieces back to back in order to create slimmer dams.

The Set is inspired by a Set for Simcity 4 which was made by a player named Jeronij: http://sc4devotion.com/csxlex/lex_filed ... lotGET=112
However, I modeled all the pieces in this set from scratch for Theotown.

The set is, in my eyes, equally well suited for urban and for more rural or industrial settings (See images below).

Have fun!

UPDATE:
Thanks to @KoalaGuy , we now also have a linetool version of the seawalls:
http://www.theotown.com/forum/viewtopic ... 034#p71034
I recommend using them together with my original puzzle pieces (zip file below). There is no need to remove or replace the old version.

TV Tower mdk_813 UPDATE [public].author: mdk_813
TV Tower mdk_813 UPDATE [public].descrip:
Hi guys,
here I have a TV Tower on a 2x2 lot which appears in the public menu.
The tower is loosely based on the Olympic Tower in Munich which was constructed for the Olympic Games of 1972. Today, it is still a well-known landmark and a popular tourist attraction due to its viewing plattform and its revolving restaurant.

In the game, the tower will act as a super-radio station that offers considerable influence on management, low education, park, religion and sport. It can only be build once in a city and it has certain requirements, namely the rank "big city" and the regular radio station (meaning the radio station must exist in your city).
I wanted to set the upgraded radio stations also as requirements, but it turned out that the game does not offer that option, so I restricted the requirements to the rank and the regular radio station only, while reducing the influence radius a bit, in order to balance that out.
The price of the TV tower is 30000T and it costs 150T per month.

Have fun!


 TV_Tower_2x2_mdk_813.zip
(15.33 KiB) Downloaded 616 times









UPDATE:
Due to the help of Lobby I was able to make a taller version of the TV Tower, which probably looks more realistic.
It does not replace the earlier small version, it is rather an additional plugin that you can use independently from the earlier one. So, that means you can have both towers or choose the one you like better. I did not bother to change the lot or anything, because you probably won't build both towers right next to each other anyway.

Please note:
Because of the building height larger than 256px a minor display error occurs. The building pops up a bit too late at the lower end of the screen when you scroll. I don't think this is a problem really, but you should be aware of that issue and probably don't use this version if it bothers you too much.

The taller tower also has some other stats:
- it requires rank "Metropolis" and the regular radio station.
- it has a larger influence radius (value 475 instead of 400)
- its price is 35kT and monthly cost is 200T (so, it is a bit more expensive)
- it can only be built once (but you can have both the small and the tall tower at the same time)



 TV_Tower_tall_2x2_mdk_813.zip

Re: Modular Park Sets by mdk_813 [park].author: mdk_813
Re: Modular Park Sets by mdk_813 [park].descrip:
So guys,
I've got a BIG one for you today:
The Modular Park Set by mdk_813

This set is so extensive, I decided to split it up into five parts. You can download all of them or you can select the parts that you want and leave out those which you do not need or want.
In total the sets contain 94 individual pieces that are grouped in 27 entries in the park menu. This might seem a bit overwhelming but I tried to group them logically, so don't worry.

----
Before we look closer at the different sets, here is some possibly useful advice about placing puzzle tiles, as I understand that this can get tedious:
It is usually a good idea to determine the rough shape of what you want to build by placing the corner pieces first. This helps in deciding which pieces need to be put in which spot. Then you continue with intersections and if provided endpieces. Finally, you place the straights. Following these steps could probably spare you from having to switch back and fourth between different pieces all the time 
----

So, here is a rundown of what the sets contain:

- Modular Park pt.1 (Trees):
This Set can be considered the basic Starter Set. It contains simple 1x1-park lots. a lot with grass, some different trees and palms and a flowerbed.
The trees were originally made by Lobby and Theo, I simply adjusted the tree foundation in some of the lots. The grass, the palms and the flowerbed are mine. Actually, the palms can be also found in my palms and bushes plugin for the terrain menu which you can find here: viewtopic.php?f=58&t=3739
The concrete texture is modeled to align with Lobby's and Theo's concrete-park tiles, but it is infact a different texture generated by me. The palms come both on the grass texture and on the concrete texture. The latter allow you to use them between the lanes of avenues for example.


 Modular_Park_pt1_trees_mdk_813.zip
(67.12 KiB) Downloaded 578 times









- Modular Park pt.2 (Parkway):
This Set contains a number o1x1-tiles that allow you to create parkways and squares. It uses the same concrete texture which blends in with the one by Lobby and Theo.
The slim parkway iincludes straights, straights with bench and lamp. corners, crossings and  T-intersections.
The wider Square-pieces include Straights, straights with bench and lamp, outside and inside corners, T-Intersections and semi-T-Intersections (which open up to the left or the right respectively). All of these square-pieces allow you to place original park-tiles from the game next to them in order to create, as the name suggests, larger squares.


 Modular_Park_pt2_parkway_mdk_813.zip
(163.82 KiB) Downloaded 535 times








Update:

Philippine Plug-ins.author: itsaivs
Philippine Plug-ins.descrip:
In accordance with the celebration of 119th Independence Day of the Republic of the Philippines, this pack includes:

1. Independence flag pole - Standing at 150ft. (45.72m) it is the highest flag pole in the country. It is in the location where the Philippine flag was hoisted on July 4, 1946, when full independence was achieved from the United States. (The Philippines gained first independence from Spain on June 12, 1898).

2. Philippine flag - A horizontal bicolor of blue and red; with a white equilateral triangle based at the hoist containing three, 5-pointed gold stars at its vertices, and an 8-rayed gold sun at its center.
Royal blue field symbolizes peace, truth, and justice.
Scarlet red field symbolizes patriotism and valor. When red field is on top, it means the country is in state of war.
White triangle symbolizes equality and brotherhood.
Three stars on the corners of the triangle symbolizes the three main geographical regions of the country namely Luzon, the Visayas, and Mindanao.
The sun at the center of the triangle has eight rays representing the eight Philippine provinces that started the revolt against Spain.

3. Dr. Jose Rizal Monument - It is the most securely guarded public monument in the Philippines being continuously guarded by Philippine Marine Corps Marine Security and Escort Group. The monument consists of a standing bronze sculpture of the Rizal, with an obelisk, set on a stone base within which his remains are buried. Jose Rizal fought against Spaniards not by guns nor swords but by pen and papers. His writings, particularly the Noli me Tangere (The Social Cancer) and El Filibusterismo (The Reign of Greed) were viewed as the guiding force for other patriots to rally for the Philippine Revolution.

4. Shrine of Valor - The memorial shrine complex was built to honor and remember the gallantry of Filipino and American soldiers who fought during World War II. The white Memorial Cross stands as a remembrance to the soldiers who fought and lost their lives in the Battle of Bataan. 

5. Memorial to the Heroes - Mother Philippines - It is a memorial honoring the Filipinos who lived and died in defiance of the repressive regime that ruled over the country from 1972 to 1986. Depicting the self-sacrifice of a fallen figure of a man, held in one hand by the rising figure of a woman who symbolizes the Motherland, while her other hand reaches for the glorious sun of freedom. 

Here is the link:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ggfhqfywrfj76 ... k.zip?dl=0

I dedicate these plug-ins to the patriots who fought for independence from foreign oppressors; To the courageous who revolt against the regime of ruthless homegrown tyrants to restore the freedom and democracy; And to the braves who offered their lives while fighting for peace against terrorism and extremism encroach in our nation. Your ultimate sacrifices are never forgotten.

Ang mamatay ng dahil sa iyo (For us, thy sons to suffer and die).

St. Theo General Hospital mdk_813.author: mdk_813
St. Theo General Hospital mdk_813.descrip:
Hi,
as I am not really a fan of the current large hospital's design (no offense, it just looks a bit outdated), I decided to make a new large hospital.
It roughly has a 30% larger radius and an approx. 20% larger capacity than the ingame hospital. But, it also costs a bit more and it requires a city rank of 7.
So, nothing good comes free, right?

I wasn't able to determine whether the blue or the grey version was better, so I decided to offer both for download. You can choose your favorite or you can use both at the same time, which I would probably recommend as long as you have enough plugin texture to spare, because it would increase building variety.
The plugins also include trees and an emergency vehicle by Lobby and Theo.

PLEASE NOTE: Both versions require the MyRedLight animation, which you need to download separately from here:
viewtopic.php?f=73&t=4476
You cannot use the hospitals without this animation, because otherwise it would produce an error and the game won't start!!!

Have fun!

Diamond Mine Project.descrip:
hello,  

-i finished building my first plug-in 3 days ago(note that it has many imperfections and a lil off scale and measurement).had it for 2 days in my game files without any issues, there is nothing i can add to it. there were few details that i wanted to add but due to size limitation i couldn't. also i wanted to add smoke so bad but it's a lil complicated for me. maybe in future.

Cat.descrip:
Today, I have a big building for you, it's a statue of "Guard of Meow", also called " a cat". 
It's not a 2000 lines complex plugin, it's a cultural building for your inhabitants (including cats). I haven't spent much time on this one, just wanted a cat in my city. Do you want a cat in your city? Yes, you do, I can see you smiling 
Real life height would be about 101,333333... meters, don't climb on it, falling may hurt! 
It costs 100,000T to build with a monthly price of 10T, and it requires a rich population of 1,000 (they must own cats tho!). It has "draw ground":true, so using Terrain Paint plugin, @Josh's or @Matison55557's decals is recommended!
Enjoy!  

Download here

Some questions you may ask, and my answers:
Q - Why did you make this?
A - I made this because I was live streaming with this song playing, so I built a beach called "La Cat", then I suddenly wanted to build a giant cat.

Q - Why does it cost so much?
A - Building a 101m high cat isn't easy, ya know.

Q - Why is it so big?
A - Why not?

Q - Meow meow?
A - Meow, meow meow meow.

Q - This building is ugly!
A - That's not a question, silly.

Offshore Oil Platform mdk_813 [award].author: mdk_813
Offshore Oil Platform mdk_813 [award].descrip:
Hi,
here is another award-building, I was sitting on for quite a while now. I decided to finally release it now, because I'm unsure what else I could do to it.
It is a 6x6 offshore oil drilling platform, that is awarded as soon as you have both the large oil tanks and the large oil refinery in your city which are growable industrial buildings in the game.
The oil rig itself is purely eye candy, it does not have any influences.
You can build the oil rig three times in your city.
The oil rig only builds on water.

The design, by the way, is loosely based on the Norwegian "Troll-Stations" from Statoil.

PLEASE NOTE:
Again, just like with my hospital plugin, you must download the animation file provided in the following thread and add it to your plugin folder:
viewtopic.php?f=73&t=4476
The oil rig does not work without this animation!
However, if you've already downloaded this plugin before and if you've added it to your plugin folder, you do not need to download it again.
Anyone else will need to download this animation to make the oil rig work!

Have fun!

WTC Twin Towers mdk_813 [award].author: mdk_813
WTC Twin Towers mdk_813 [award].descrip:
Hi,
on this date I would like to publish a special plugin:
The Twin Towers of the former World Trade Center in New York City.

Today is the 16th anniversary of one of the most severe terror attacks in history which took thousands of lives. Their aftermath caused even more suffering and influences global politics even up to this day.
During my childhood, the Twin Towers of the WTC had always been sort of the epitome of a skyscraper. Whenever I heard that term "skyscraper", I had a picture of these towers in my mind, and I still admire their clean and elegant architecture today. Therefore, I thought it fitting to release this plugin on this date in order to commemorate the towers and the events that will always be connected to them.

The Set consists of two separate plugins which will appear in the award menu. The first plugin includes the two towers, each on a 4x4 lot and the second includes some 1x1 park tiles and a 2x2 sculpture. The tree on one of the 1x1 lots was made by Lobby and Theo.
All buildings require the rank "big city" to be built, and the towers can only be built once.

Note also that the towers are not to scale, even though they exceed the recommended maximum building height for plugins of 256px by far. This extreme height has the downside of causing the buildings to pop in or out of view quite abruptly at the bottom of the screen in lower zoom stages when you scroll across the map. If that bothers you, don't download this plugin!

PLEASE, do not start any political discussions below!
I understand that this subject might be controversial, but this is not the right place for any of that.

Thank you!



 WTC_mdk_813.zip
(107.71 KiB) Downloaded 910 times




 WTC_park_mdk_813.zip
(23.91 KiB) Downloaded 711 times

Sunken Highway Walls mdk_813 [Deco].author: mdk_813
Sunken Highway Walls mdk_813 [Deco].descrip:
Hi my fellow Theonians,
this one might be one of my last plugins for an unforeseeable time, as I will have much less time for personal stuff in the coming months due to professional reasons.
But in the meantime, I would like to finally share my Sunken Highway Walls, which some of you might have seen already on a screenshot in another thread some weeks ago. I've been pondering over this plugin for a long time now, considering to change this and that, but now I realized, that most likely I won't do anything more to it. So I thought, I might as well release it now, before forgetting all about it. The walls are probably not perfect, but some of you might find them useful anyway.

The plugin can create the illusion of a layered surface. It works different to Kingtut's Elevated Terrain in that it is purely fake-3D. It does not actually add a an additional level of terrain, it just looks that way. You can use it to create the appearance of both a higher and a lower level (see images below).

The set contains five different rotation aware puzzle pieces, that you will have to place one by one. (Sorry, a linetool is not possible here. Believe me, I've tried it...):
- a straight piece
- an outer corner
- an inner corner
- a right end
- a left end
I recommend using the end-pieces next to crossing bridges to make a believable transition, as underbridge-pieces are not possible, as far as I know.

The pieces have a minimal (monthly) price, but of course you can set these to 0 in the json if you choose so.

Of course, You can use these walls with any street-type, not only with highways, or even without any road at all.

Have fun!

Flag Pack + Templates mdk_813 [deco].author: mdk_813
Flag Pack + Templates mdk_813 [deco].descrip:
Hi folks,
as one of the most popular plugins for theotown, the flags by "Sometheotown mayor", won't be developed any further, I decided to release my personal flag plugin which I made quite some month ago. It was initially part of my Modular Park Set but I've never released it so far (Look at the screenshot of the Modular Park and you'll see it! It's funny that nobody ever noticed it  ).

The set contains numerous flags of different countries that use "draw ground". That means, the game’s ground texture will be visible.
If you want to place the flag on another texture, I recommend you use Josh’s “ground” decals, because they will allow you to place different textures beneath these flags inside the game.
Here is a link to @Josh ’s decals:
viewtopic.php?f=76&t=4654

The foundation of the flagpole is taken from the game and was made by Lobby & Theo.

Please note, that I won't take any requests to make additional flags, because I just don't have any time for that!
However, below I'll provide you with templates (PSD and TIF as well as the JSON) to create your own flags.
You can use free applications  like GIMP or Paint.net (plugins may be necessary) to open and edit these template images. The JSON can be edited with Wordpad on Windows for example. I’m sure, there are options to edit these files on Android as well (if you know some apps, please write a comment below!)

How to use these templates:
The template images contain several layers (listed here from bottom  to top):
the flagpole
three layers for each flag size (6px, 7px and 8px. Pick the one you need according to the complexity of your flag!):
	an example layer .
a bright green layer reserved for your personal design (paint here! You only need the base-colors!).
a layer for lights and shadows (Don’t touch this!).
Remember: Only work on the bright green layers! Pick the colors you need and paint over the green flag. Note that the flag is bend due to the wind so that your flag design needs to have some steps in it (Consult the example layers to see what I mean)
Save your finished flag as a PNG-file. Use the naming structure that I have provided and replace “YOURCOUNTRY” and “USERNAME” according to your flag.
Inside the json, you also have to replace "YOURCOUNTRY" and "USERNAME" the same way. Make sure the file name specified in "frames" is exactly the same as the name of the image which you created before! Then, save the json and again replace "YOURCOUNTRY" and "USERNAME" accordingly.
Finally, put your PNG and JSON into a folder, which you give the same name as the JSON (without the file-extension). Then pack this folder to a zip-file and transfer it to your device.
You are free to share your creations in this thread below as zip-files (and nowhere else!). It is important that you adhere to the provided naming convention, in order to avoid conflicts with the flags of other users.
Please add a screenshot from the game so that people can see what they're downloading!

Have fun!

Traffic Barriers mdk_813 [deco].author: mdk_813
Traffic Barriers mdk_813 [deco].descrip:
Hi,
this time I would like to present a selection of traffic barriers which you can use for your highways, but also avenues and other road types.
It consists of three separate plugins so that you can select the parts you want to use and leave out those which you won't need. 

Here are the three parts:



 traffic_barrier_median_Linetool_mdk_813.zip
(18.18 KiB) Downloaded 715 times



This is probably the basic and most important part, which works fine on its own, i.e. even without the other two parts.
It adds median barriers which are intended to be placed between the lanes of a highway.
It consists of two linetools, one with lamps, one without lamps. Personally I think the spacing between the lamps in the linetool is too narrow, but I included it anyway, because some people might feel different about it. But I also added a rotation aware puzzle piece with a lamp that allows you to create variable spacings between the lamps.
To use this you would want to draw a barrier with the linetool without lamps first and then put the single lamp piece over it whereever you want a lamp to be. I suggest to place on every second tile (see example picture above). As long as you don't draw over it with the linetool again, the barriers will retain a correct transition to the puzzle pieces.



 traffic_barrier_single_mdk_813.zip
(26.61 KiB) Downloaded 534 times


This is an optional part. It adds puzzle pieces of single barriers which are intended to be placed at the sides of the lanes. I wanted to make these as linetools, too, but unfortunately map rotation wouldn't work due to the asymmetry of the tiles. So I had to stick to rotation aware puzzle pieces.
Note that outer corners are not included because they are unnecessary. Just leave the outer corner tiles empty.



 traffic_barrier_single_Soundwall_mdk_813.zip
(43.88 KiB) Downloaded 538 times


This is another optional part. It acts as an addon to my New Soundwalls plugin: viewtopic.php?f=70&t=4279
Essentially, these pieces are the same as the above single barriers just with Soundwalls added to them. You can use these pieces in conjunction with my New Soundwalls in places where you want to have a barrier at the side of the roads. Again, a linetool is not possible here unfortunately.
These pieces have the same noise reductive function as the New Soundwalls.
Please note, that here you would have to place the provided outer corner (OC) tiles.


Below is an overview of the included tools and pieces:

this is a selection of smaller props that I've made here and there over the last couple of months.

And that's about it.

Have fun!

UPDATE:
By suggestion of @Josh I somewhat darkened the two phonebooths. And, I also changed the public toilet a bit (note that I didn't bother to update the screenshot, because the changes are rather minor).
If these things were bothering you too, then go ahead and redownload. Just replace the old file with the new one.

Greenhouse mdk_813 [deco].descrip:
Hi,
this is a modular greenhouse, which you can use to further decorate your farming areas.
The set consists of three different buildings (all rotation aware):
- a 2x2 single greenhouse, which you can place individually.
- 2x2 connector pieces (purple)...
- and 2x2 endpieces (orange) which you can use to build larger greenhouses.

The single greenhouse costs 2000T and the modular pieces cost 1000T each.

That's it basically.

Have fun!

Important!:

The water animal graphics are mine, the land animals are by Lobby.

Before using the animals, it is best to place a road around the area where you want them to stay.
The fish do not die out by themselves.  The animals will, if the enclosed area is greater than 3 tiles wide by 3 high and up to 70x70, 50x100, etc.  They spread when yellow, spread more when red, turn green when dead.  The land animals remove themselves when the last yellow one ceases to exist.  If there are no road limiters, you will have to pause the game and remove them yourself once they cease spreading.

Remember, they will eat just about anything except roads, bridges, and public buildings.

NEW Soundwalls Linetool by mdk_813 [deco.author: mdk_813
NEW Soundwalls Linetool by mdk_813 [deco.descrip:
Hi folks,
today I have some New Soundwalls for you which are not puzzle pieces but a linetool that uses "frame alignment" and works just as the road tools do.

It is a complete rework of my first plugin for Theotown, which back then I could not have done without the help of Dusko who kindly provided a json file.
You can find the old Soundwalls here: viewtopic.php?f=63&t=3394
Here you can follow the initial development of the old plugin: viewtopic.php?f=34&t=3384

There are a number of reasons for this rework:
- I wanted to turn the Soundwalls into a linetool to make their placement much easier.
- The Soundwalls have reworked textures so that they look less plain now.
- The shadows have been reworked so that the "dent" from the shadows of the original walls is eliminated.
- The new Soundwalls now have the ability to form X- and T-intersections.
- I plan on including the Walls in a future plugin, but unfortunaley Dusko has been unreachable for quite some time now, so it became necessary to create a whole new plugin.

As I've said, the New Soundwalls are a linetool which you can use to draw walls the same way as you would draw a road.
It still has a noise reductive function but it is now part of the deco menu (whereas the old walls were in the park menu).

Have fun!

P.S. Dusko, if you read this, we miss you here!

Disastrous Disasters BETA.descrip:
Today I present you a plugin which I made aiming to have more interesting gameplay in TheoTown. Disastrous Disasters! This plugin adds random disasters, and even better, you can customize it! After you place the building found in disasters category, you can select the chance of disasters to spawn (from 0.25x to HELL), also you can choose which disasters should spawn and some other options (currently only Russian Roulette).
I hope you like it! 
Please comment your thoughts about the customizable settings which I added, because I really like it. 

Tested by: DSA Disaster Engineers and KoalaPlugins team.

How to install in your city:
1. After installing the plugin, place the building from disasters category somewhere in your city, I recommend the end of the map.
2. Unpause the game and wait until you get a notification "Disastrous Disasters plugin has been installed!"
3. Adjust the settings how you like. 
The yellow light tile shows current state ( yellow - settings not set up, red - missing tiles, green - working), the "0x" shows current chance for disasters to spawn,tap on it to adjust the chances, tap on the settings tile to adjust which disasters can spawn and tap on tile with red X to reset settings. Have fun!

Please remember that this plugin is still under beta testing!!!

Download BETA here

MyRedLight mdk_813 [animation].author: mdk_813
MyRedLight mdk_813 [animation].descrip:
This plugin is a dependency for future plugins.
Basically it is a blinking version of my red signal lights which can be found on my TV Tower for example.
The unzipped folder is named "00_MyRedLight_5x5_mdk_813" so that it is loaded before my other plugins.
I will upload some plugins that use this animation and I may update older plugins to include it as well in the future.

Just put the unzipped folder in your plugin-folder.

If you like to make use of this animation in your own plugins, simply add the following code with your indivdual coordinates:
Code: Select all"animation":[{"id":"MyRedLight_5x5.mdk_813","x":...,"y":...}],
In case you are unsure on how to determine the correct coordinates, please refer to this thread, which deals with exactly this 5x5-animation:
viewtopic.php?f=42&t=4147

And don't forget to credit me in the json and in the forums!

Have fun!


Edit: I corrected a mistake in the png-file. To those two guys who already downloaded it: Sorry please download again!

More categories 1.3 by Matison55557.descrip:
This plugin only adds new categories. No buildings are included!
I made this plugin so you won't have to make your own categories. Please give me suggestions on what categories to make next.
Currently it has 8 categories: Post service, Plazas and Squares, Space, Props, Ancient, Medieval, Water decorations, Coast guard. Hopefully there will be more... 

If you want to include your building in a category, please insert one of these lines:
Post service
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_post"
Plazas and Squares
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_plazas"
Space
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_space"
Graffiti / Props
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_graffiti"
Ancient
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_ancient"
Medieval
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_medieval"
Water decorations / Objects placeable on water
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_onwater"
Coast guard
Code: Select all"category":"$cat_newcat_coastguard" 

If you want to share a building that uses one of these categories, please include an information "More Categories plugin is required".

Download
Again, if you have suggestions for new categories write them below.
